summary: Add support for Eager Workflow Start (EWS) in the TypeScript SDK, a feature that reduces workflow start latency by allowing clients to schedule the first workflow task directly to a local worker. This feature is already supported in Java, Python, Core, and Go SDKs and depends on another TypeScript SDK issue.
userImpact: Users can achieve lower latency when starting workflows by leveraging eager workflow start capability available in other SDKs.
proposedFix: Implement Eager Workflow Start support in the TypeScript SDK, dependent on issue #3776
resolutionDetails: Feature was implemented and merged into the TypeScript SDK
keyQuote: Support for Eager Workflow Start (EWS) was added in the server in 1.20, and is currently supported in Java, Python, Core, and Go SDKs.
